description:
Rainier - Genesys Cloud Automation via IIB - ApplyUserConfigs API. *Background:*

The Genesys Cloud application is a comprehensive cloud-based contact center platform designed to help organizations manage and optimize customer experience and engagement across multiple channels like voice, chat, email, text etc. 

Currently, a manual process is followed to configure Genesys Cloud access for new users when they fill the required fields and submit the “Office Phone Add/Change” form in Rainier. The process includes assigning roles, divisions, phone numbers, skills, queues, etc. The configuration is based on a *model user* (a reference user whose settings are copied).

*Purpose:*

The requirement is to reduce manual intervention when a new user request is created in Rainier and automate the Genesys Cloud user setup process, using a model user as a template, to save time, reduce errors, and ensure consistency.

*Flow:*

Rainier >> IIB >> Genesys App >> Genesys Cloud

*Scope for IIB:* 

* When an user fills the “Office Phone Add/Change” form in Rainier and clicks submit, Rainier will do an internal check using the business unit/country of the requester (i.e.) the target user to determine the Genesys cloud org the user belongs to.
** WK has two separate Genesys Cloud Orgs: 
*** Org 1: For EMEA + APAC users
*** Org 2: For North America users
* Rainier will call IIB using an API call with the genesys cloud org, email ID or target user and model user.
* Upon receiving the request from Rainier, IIB will call Genesys cloud app to receive the access token. On receiving the OAuth token, IIB will call the API - ApplyUserConfigs exposed by Genesys App using the details received in the request from Rainier.
* IIB will not perform any field level validations or business transformations and will act as a passthrough layer.
* Genesys App will interact will Genesys Cloud and orchestrate a series of calls to get the user configuration details of the model user and apply the same user configurations to the target user.
* This orchestration may take up to 30-40 minutes. In the meantime, an acknowledgement is sent to Rainier stating the request is in process.
* Once the configurations are applied to the target user, Genesys App makes a callback request to IIB.
* In case of failure, detailed error response will be sent to Rainier.

*Out of Scope:*

# Updating existing phone configuration through Rainier request forms.
# Any request related to MS teams will not be part of this requirement.

*Service Portfolio:*    [ApplyUserConfigs_Genesys_Req_V1|https://wolterskluwer.sharepoint.com/teams/GBS-IIB/Lists/Integration%20Services%20Portfolio/DispForm.aspx?ID=936&e=hjWyfU]

ECG : Blackduck Logback 1.5.15 Vulnerability. Below *Open* vulnerability was identified in ECG Dev environment as part of latest Blackduck scan on {{2025-12-08}} 

|*CVE ID*|*Type*|*Packages*|*Package Version*|*CVSS*|*Short Term Recommendation & Long term Recommendation*|*Severity*|
|BDSA-2024-9866,BDSA-2024-9861|maven|*logback*|1.5.15|6.8|[+Logback 1.5.+|https://blackduck.gsdwkglobal.com/api/components/6ca9663c-41d4-44c0-8d1e-b1b12745bdc5/versions/3058766b-b6c6-40e8-9dfb-6e4ee6c8a484]+21+|Medium|

h3. Description

Logback is vulnerable to arbitrary code execution. A privileged attacker could exploit this by compromising an existing logback configuration file or by injecting an environment variable before program execution. Successful exploitation requires both the Janino library and Spring Framework to be present on the user's class path.

Rainier - Genesys Cloud Automation via IIB - ApplyUserConfigs API. *Background:*

The Genesys Cloud application is a comprehensive cloud-based contact center platform designed to help organizations manage and optimize customer experience and engagement across multiple channels like voice, chat, email, text etc. 

Currently, a manual process is followed to configure Genesys Cloud access for new users when they fill the required fields and submit the “Office Phone Add/Change” form in Rainier. The process includes assigning roles, divisions, phone numbers, skills, queues, etc. The configuration is based on a *model user* (a reference user whose settings are copied).

*Purpose:*

The requirement is to reduce manual intervention when a new user request is created in Rainier and automate the Genesys Cloud user setup process, using a model user as a template, to save time, reduce errors, and ensure consistency.

*Flow:*

Rainier >> IIB >> Genesys App >> Genesys Cloud

*Scope for IIB:* 

* When an user fills the “Office Phone Add/Change” form in Rainier and clicks submit, Rainier will do an internal check using the business unit/country of the requester (i.e.) the target user to determine the Genesys cloud org the user belongs to.
** WK has two separate Genesys Cloud Orgs: 
*** Org 1: For EMEA + APAC users
*** Org 2: For North America users
* Rainier will call IIB using an API call with the genesys cloud org, email ID or target user and model user.
* Upon receiving the request from Rainier, IIB will call Genesys cloud app to receive the access token. On receiving the OAuth token, IIB will call the API - ApplyUserConfigs exposed by Genesys App using the details received in the request from Rainier.
* IIB will not perform any field level validations or business transformations and will act as a passthrough layer.
* Genesys App will interact will Genesys Cloud and orchestrate a series of calls to get the user configuration details of the model user and apply the same user configurations to the target user.
* This orchestration may take up to 30-40 minutes. In the meantime, an acknowledgement is sent to Rainier stating the request is in process.
* Once the configurations are applied to the target user, Genesys App makes a callback request to IIB.
* In case of failure, detailed error response will be sent to Rainier.

*Out of Scope:*

# Updating existing phone configuration through Rainier request forms.
# Any request related to MS teams will not be part of this requirement.

Phase-3: Admin Dashboard page. *1.1.       Use case name:* Admin Dashboard Page

*1.2.       Use case description:* User should be able to open the Admin Dashboard page after login and user should be able to navigate to other product related pages from the dashboard. 

*1.3.       Access Required for functionality:* Admin

*1.4.       Preconditions:* The user has logged into the Enterprise Data Portal by providing valid WK credentials.

*1.5.       Success End conditions:*

1.5.1.User can successfully view the Admin Dashboard Page

1.5.2.User can navigate to other Admin related pages from the dashboard. 

*1.6.       Failed end Condition:*

1.6.2.User can’t navigate to other Admin related pages from the dashboard

*1.7.       Primary actors*

1.7.1.Authorized EDP User 

1.7.2.Enterprise Data Portal system

1.9.2.4.           Link for “File Upload”

Read-Only role changes for the EDP application. h3. *Update: Read-Only Role Changes Across All Use Cases*

# *Current Setup*
The MDC application currently has a single role: *"Read-Only"*, which is applied uniformly across all modules.
# *Upcoming Changes*
To better align with module specific access needs, we are introducing *two distinct Read-Only roles*:
#* *ReadOnly_MasterData* – applicable to all *Master Data* modules
#* *ReadOnly_Finance* – applicable to all *Finance* modules these role will be visible in the Admin form. They are intended only for the Technical team.
# *Reference Material*
Please refer to the ([Read Only Roles for Enterprise Data Portal.pptx|https://wolterskluwer.sharepoint.com/:p:/r/teams/GBS_Support/Shared%20Documents/Enterprise%20Data%20Portal/02%20Requirement%20Docs/Read%20Only%20Roles%20for%20Enterprise%20Data%20Portal.pptx?d=w34024b9dad66479687437a5428a09bde&csf=1&web=1&e=Us80Og]) for a detailed overview of all planned changes
